findings.title: Improved Reentrancy Protection in ContractGuard::onlyOneBlock()
findings.description: Violation of `checks-effects-interactions` principle in `ContractGuard::onlyOneBlock()` modifier, which can lead to re-entrancy attacks.

findings.title: Potential Overflow Mitigation in notifyRewardAmount()
findings.description: The `rewardPerToken()` routine involves the multiplication of three `uint256` integers, which is possible for their multiplication to have an undesirable overflow, especially when the `rewardRate` is largely controlled by an external entity.

findings.title: Redundant Logic Removal in LLCUSDTLPTokenSharePool
findings.description: The `LLCUSDTLPTokenSharePool` smart contract has unused code or unnecessary redundancies that can be safely removed, specifically a redundant check on the `referer` presence for the calling user in the `stake()` function.

findings.title: Simplified Logic in getReward()
findings.description: The current implementation logic of the `getReward()` routine can be further optimized.

findings.title: Improved Logic in Router::swapAndAddLiquidity()
findings.description: The approve() routine may have idiosyncrasies from current widely-used token contracts and can mitigate the known approve()/transferFrom() race condition.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the `ChocolateCash` contract, there is a privileged `admin` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the system- wide operations.
